q: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
h:
“Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: To lose your temper is only useful once a year.
h:
“To lose your temper is only useful once a year.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
h:
“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.” —
Walt Disney

q: Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.
h:
“Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.” —
Unknown

q: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
h:
“It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.
h:
“Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.” —
Bette Midler

q: Each problem has a positive side.
h:
“Each problem has a positive side.” —
Og Mandino

q: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
h:
“The most effective way to do it, is to do it.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
h:
“The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing. ” —
Henry Ford

q: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
h:
“It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.” —
Aristotle

q: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
h:
“Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body. ” —
Seneca

q: Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.
h:
“Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.” —
Celestine Chua

q: You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
h:
“You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.” —
Dan Millman

q: Resentment or grudges do no harm to the person against whom you hold these feelings but every day and every night of your life, they are eating at you.
h:
“Resentment or grudges do no harm to the person against whom you hold these feelings but every day and every night of your life, they are eating at you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.
h:
“People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.” —

q: It is not as important how we start, but how we finish.
h:
“It is not as important how we start, but how we finish.” —

q: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
h:
“Quality is not an act, it is a habit.” —
Aristotle

q: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
h:

Morgan Wootten

q: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
h:
“With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Change is not a four letter word...but often your reaction to it is!
h:
“Change is not a four letter word...but often your reaction to it is!” —

q: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
h:

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: We become brave by doing brave acts.
h:
“We become brave by doing brave acts.” —
Aristotle

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —

q: The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.
h:

q: As you love yourself, life loves you back.
h:

q: How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.

q: It's always to soon to quit!
h:
“It's always to soon to quit!” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
h:
“The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: No matter how tall the mountain is, it cannot block the sun.
h:
“No matter how tall the mountain is, it cannot block the sun.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The future depends on what you do today.
h:
“The future depends on what you do today. ” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
h:

q: The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.
h:

q: Only the educated are free.
h:
“Only the educated are free.” —
Epictetus

q: The divine is not something high above us. It is in heaven, it is in earth, it is inside us.
h:

Morihei Ueshiba

q: A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.
h:

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
h:

Lao Tzu

q: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.
h:

q: I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.
h:
“I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.” —
Euripides

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:
“The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.
h:
“We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.” —

q: Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.
h:

Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
h:
“No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.” —
Euripides

q: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free.
h:

q: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
h:

Charles Swindoll

q: Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.
h:

Carl Jung

q: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami

q: If it's not broken, tinker with it till you find out how it works.
h:

q: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
h:
“Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.” —

q: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.
h:
“Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
h:

q: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
h:

q: There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.

“There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.” —

h:
“You have to keep breaking your heart until it opens.” —

q: Resentment or grudges do no harm to the person against whom you hold these feelings but every day and every night of your life, they are eating at you.
h:
“Resentment or grudges do no harm to the person against whom you hold these feelings but every day and every night of your life, they are eating at you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.
h:

Unknown

q: If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.
h:
“If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.” —

q: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
h:

q: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” —

q: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
h:
“Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.” —

q: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
h:
“Never spend your money before you have earned it.” —

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:

q: You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb a little himself.
h:

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:

Stephen King

q: Man's character is his fate.
h:

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:
“Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.” —
Mark Twain

q: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
h:

q: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.
h:
“Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.” —

q: Correct what you can. Learn from what you can't.
h:

q: In the middle of chaos lies opportunity.
h:

q: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
h:
“There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
h:

Thomas Jefferson

q: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
h:

q: Heaven is right where you are standing.
h:
“Heaven is right where you are standing.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
h:
“A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.” —

q: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
h:
“If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.” —

q: Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.
h:

q: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
h:
“Change your thoughts and you change your world.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Each problem has a positive side.
h:
“Each problem has a positive side.” —
Og Mandino

q: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
h:

q: When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.
h:

q: Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.

q: Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
h:

q: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.

q: Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.
h:

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:

Unknown

q: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
h:

q: You are what you do, not what you say you'll do.
h:

q: Truth is like most opinions - best unexpressed.
h:

q: Your mind is infinite, it's your doubts that are limiting.
h:

q: We become what we believe.
h:

q: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.
h:

q: Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.
h:

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:

q: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
h:

q: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without one.
h:
“Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without one.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
h:
“For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
h:
“If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.” —
Mark Twain

q: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
h:
“If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Each problem has a positive side.
h:
“Each problem has a positive side.” —
Og Mandino

q: Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.
h:

q: What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?
h:

q: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.
h:

q: There are three classes of people: those who see. Those who see when they are shown. Those who do not see.
h:

q: There are no constraints on the human mind, no walls around the human spirit, no barriers to our progress except those we ourselves erect.
h:

q: Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.
h:

q: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
h:

q: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
h:

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —

q: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
h:

q: Being a good example is the best form of service.
h:
“Being a good example is the best form of service.” —

q: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
h:

h:
“Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.” —

q: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
h:

q: The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.
h:

Eckhart Tolle

q: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
h:
“As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
h:
“Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.” —
John Wooden

q: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
h:
“There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.” —
Plato

q: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
h:
“You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.” —
James Cameron

q: It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.
h:
“It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.” —

q: Great loves too must be endured.
h:
“Great loves too must be endured.” —
Coco Chanel

q: When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.
h:
“When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Sorrow is how we learn to love.
h:
“Sorrow is how we learn to love.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
h:
“Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.” —
Carl Bard

q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
h:
“Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.
h:
“I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.
h:
“The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
h:
“Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: No man can get rich himself unless he enriches others.
h:
“No man can get rich himself unless he enriches others.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
h:
“Change your thoughts and you change your world.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.
h:
“Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.” —
Unknown

q: What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
h:
“Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
h:
“The future is no more uncertain than the present.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
h:
“Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
h:
“Without the rain there would be no rainbow.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Watch what you say, and whatever you say, practice it.
h:
“Watch what you say, and whatever you say, practice it.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.
h:
“We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: The Only Thing That Is Constant Is Change
h:
“The Only Thing That Is Constant Is Change” —
Heraclitus

q: Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.
h:
“Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.” —
Rumi

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.
h:
“Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.
h:
“In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.
h:
“Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.
h:
“Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.
h:
“Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
h:
“A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. ” —
Buddha

q: Wisdom is doing now what you are going to be happy with later on.
h:
“Wisdom is doing now what you are going to be happy with later on.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.
h:
“We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.
h:
“Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!
h:
“Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!” —
Og Mandino

q: Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.
h:
“Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope
h:
“All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.
h:
“The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.” —
Steve Harvey

q: To lead the people, walk behind them.
h:
“To lead the people, walk behind them.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.
h:

Ralph Marston

q: It is not that we have too little time to do all the things we need to do , it is that we feel the need to do too many things in the time we have.
h:
“It is not that we have too little time to do all the things we need to do , it is that we feel the need to do too many things in the time we have.” —
Gary Keller

q: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
h:
“Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
h:
“If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
h:
“Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
h:
“The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
h:
“A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
h:
“Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing. ” —
Herodotus

q: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
h:
“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” —
Mark Twain

q: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.
h:
“Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
h:
“Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
h:
“Fiction is the truth inside the lie.” —
Stephen King

q: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
h:
“I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:
“Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.” —
Seneca

q: Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.
h:
“Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:
“The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.” —
Aristotle

q: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
h:
“I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: The greatest weariness comes from work not done.
h:
“The greatest weariness comes from work not done.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
h:
“Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Tis not too late to seek a newer world.
h:
“Tis not too late to seek a newer world.” —
Heraclitus

q: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
h:
“Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.” —
Samuel Butler

q: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
h:
“One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.
h:
“Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
h:
“Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: My instinct is always to seek out challenges as opposed to avoiding them.
h:
“My instinct is always to seek out challenges as opposed to avoiding them.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
h:
“Saying nothing sometimes says the most.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Instead of thinking outside the box, get rid of the box.
h:
“Instead of thinking outside the box, get rid of the box.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
h:
“Courage is knowing what not to fear.” —
Plato

q: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
h:
“There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it's the illusion of knowledge.
h:
“The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it's the illusion of knowledge.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
h:
“Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
h:
“When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing. ” —
Zen Proverb

q: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
h:
“Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.” —
Helen Keller

q: None but ourselves can free our minds.
h:
“None but ourselves can free our minds.” —
Bob Marley
